intro: Allosorus lorigerus, commonly known as the dwarf rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically forms dense mats of dark green, succulent leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Allosorus lorigerus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh, arid conditions.
